author: Michael Stone
title: Jeff Sessions Lied Under Oath About Meeting Russian Ambassador
text:
Attorney General Jeff Sessions, the man who claims a secular person does not understand the truth as well as a religious person, lied under oath during his confirmation hearing. 
The Washington Post reports that Sessions had two previously undisclosed meetings last year with Russia’s ambassador to the U.S. The meetings, in July and September, came at the height of Russia’s apparent cyber campaign to interfere in the presidential election. 
However, during his confirmation hearing, Sessions explicitly denied any meeting with Russian officials during the campaign, lying under oath about whether or not he had any contact with Russian officials during the campaign. 
As a result of the scandal, Sessions has “removed himself from investigations of Russian interference with the 2016 election and contacts with associates of President Donald Trump related to the campaign, as controversy grew over the former senator’s conversations with the Russian ambassador last year” according to Bloomberg . 
During a news conference in Washington Sessions said : 
I have decided now to recuse myself from any existing or future investigations of any matters related in any way to the campaigns for president of the United States. 
However, for many the recusal is not enough. Many believe Sessions should resign, and should be prosecuted for perjury for lying under oath during his confirmation hearing. 
USA Today reports: 
17 Democrats on the House Judiciary Committee asked FBI Director James Comey for a criminal investigation Thursday. The statements “could potentially implicate a number of criminal laws, including lying to Congress and perjury,” they said. 
Former Speaker of the House and House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi demanded his resignation in a press conference on Thursday. Pelosi declared : 
After lying under oath to Congress about his own communications with the Russians, the Attorney General must resign. 
Pelosi is not alone demanding that Sessions resign. Thursday morning, Senate Democratic leader Chuck Schumer also called on Sessions to resign. In addition, Senator Elizabeth Warren of Massachusetts is also calling on Sessions to resign. 
During his confirmation hearing, Sessions was asked if he believed a secular person has the same understanding of the truth as a religious individual. 
Sessions replied : 
Well, I’m not sure. 
At the same hearing, Sessions, a religious conservative, committed perjury by lying under oath about whether or not he had any contact with Russian officials during the campaign. 
Bottom line: Sessions is a liar, a perjurer, and a religious hypocrite. In short, he is unfit for office, and he should resign. Jeff Sessions (Image via Screen Grab)
